body.name: Garmin Dezl 570LMT 5-Inch GPS Navigator (Renewed)

climatePledgeFriendly.details: Pre-owned Certified: Electronics products are inspected, cleaned and (if applicable) repaired to excellent functional standards. Buying Pre-owned extends a product's life, reducing e-waste and raw material extraction.

body.description: If driving is your business, trust navigation that’s in it for the long haul. The new Garmin dēzl 570LMT truck navigators feature a 5”” glass display, lifetime North American maps1, free lifetime traffic avoidance2, custom routing3 for truck size and weight and road warnings (like weight limits and bridge heights). A Truck & Trailer Services Directory and points of interest highly-rated by truckers, including hotels, restaurants and parking. Bluetooth technology lets you call hands-free; Spoken Garmin Real Directions guide like a friend using landmarks and traffic lights. Easy Route Shaping lets you easily change your route to include preferred roads or cities, just by touching the screen. dēzl 770LMTHD and dēzl 570LMT are compatible with the Garmin BC 30 backup camera (sold separately), so you can see behind you when you move in reverse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Workes for truck driver6
reviews.reviewText: Workes great... it is probably a different operating system then your use to, so give it a try... I will say that I drove semi truck 2 years with no problem and it got me out of a pinch a few times... the down sid is the suction mount comes undone if u leave the ac off in the sun... lick it for u stick it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Forget Rand McNally.. but this GPS
reviews.reviewText: Never again will I use a Rand McNally product . Terrible devices , 4 repairs taking weeks each time it was sent back with an RMA . It's not as easy to find an address .. but it's still overall a better experience than Rand McNally ever was .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Doesn't properly track location and to top it off can't even look up any addresses even a when searching city and state only returning won't ever look at this again

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2018
reviews.reviewText: Awesome, easy to use Trucker GPS. Much better than Rand McNally

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2018
reviews.reviewText: Received promptly, item as described. Bought this gps for trucking. Works fairly well, voice command not as responsive as it should be. Voice recognition is not as good as it should be. The unit works great but the Garmin software or maps for trucking is not exact and is often misleading. It is not the unit but the garmin maps for trucking that need to be better. would by from this seller again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is a great GPS
reviews.reviewText: I purchase this GPS 03/19/18. I use it everyday when I’m on the road and I never had any problems. It let you when you have updates. I included pics showing me updating my Garmin Dezl 570. It also have several different features to help you on your route. I may upgrade to the bigger version but at this moment I’m very pleased with this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Will never buy Garmin again.
reviews.reviewText: I drive a delivery truck and I have multiple problems with how Garmin routes me.It has frequently marked locations incorrectly: Address at wrong end of the street; corner address marked on wrong street because of the building is technically closer to that street, versus the street that shares the ACTUAL address --- this also goes for marking an address completely off of it's real street and selecting a walkway, alley, or backroad, or even a road on the other side of the property that is not part of the address whatsoever, sometimes routing me a mile away or more.The "DEZL" edition I have allows me to put in vehicle dimensions, but it seems to keep routing me incorrectly, or is simply not up to date with road restrictions. So this is pretty bad for trying to an efficient route in more rural areas.Aside from that, Garmin doesn't seem to understand routing priorities for "shorter" and "faster" routes. I have often been redirected to the "faster" routes merely because of speed limits... not that "If I turn here, I'll arrive 5 minutes earlier instead of redirecting onto a highway for half a mile." So it is not an intelligent algorithm.This unit is OK for approximations, but you really need a secondary map or phone GPS to clarify things. Kinda makes this device useless and I shoulda bought a routing APP for my Android instead, and downloaded the map for my whole state for offline security. If I ever buy a standalone GPS again, I'll look at the Rand McNally ones, as I think they understand mapping way better.Google Maps is still the best I've ever used, but I wanted something less connected, lower power usage, fully downloaded maps for low signal areas, etc.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars The Garmin nuvi was better and quicker for that
reviews.reviewText: Busy screen, tmi for its size would get a 7inch next time. Most of the information is accurate but have passed through some areas where its flashing red no trucks and there are none? Also its slow to respond to detours as it wants to turn you around and send you down the road you're trying to avoid. The Garmin nuvi was better and quicker for that. However for the price I would recommend it.
